title: Tesla Could Take Back Europe’s EV Market
sub_head: The company’s new German plant seems likely to restore momentum to its European business, which previously had to rely on imports from China
body:
Ramping up production in Europe carries risks for Tesla —but many more for the electric-vehicle pioneer’s local rivals.
Tesla on Tuesday delivered its first products made in Germany in front of Chancellor Olaf Scholz and company Chief Executive Elon Musk, who offered spectators a dance. This marks the start of a ramp-up process that Mr. Musk memorably called “production hell” in 2018 when he experienced it with the Model 3 in Fremont, Calif.
